items.text: I thrive in situations where others might feel anxious or afraid.
items.rationale: Comfort in high-stress situations is a key aspect of Boldness.

items.text: He often takes charge in group settings, even when others hesitate.
items.rationale: Taking charge and leadership in uncertain situations is indicative of Boldness.

items.text: I enjoy the thrill of taking risks.
items.rationale: Risk-taking is a central component of Boldness.

items.text: She remains calm and collected in emergencies.
items.rationale: Calmness under pressure is a hallmark of Boldness.

items.text: I am not easily intimidated by authority figures.
items.rationale: Resistance to intimidation is a trait of Boldness.

items.text: He often speaks his mind, regardless of the consequences.
items.rationale: Speaking one's mind without fear of repercussions is a sign of Boldness.

items.text: I feel comfortable in unfamiliar social situations.
items.rationale: Comfort in new social settings is associated with Boldness.

items.text: She enjoys being the center of attention.
items.rationale: Enjoying attention is often linked to Boldness.

items.text: I am willing to try anything once.
items.rationale: Willingness to try new things is a characteristic of Boldness.

items.text: He rarely feels nervous before a big event.
items.rationale: Lack of nervousness in high-stakes situations is indicative of Boldness.

items.text: I often act on impulse without considering the consequences.
items.rationale: Impulsivity can be related to Boldness but also to Disinhibition.

items.text: She is known for her fearless approach to challenges.
items.rationale: Fearlessness is a trait of Boldness, though it can overlap with Meanness.

items.text: I often disregard rules if they get in my way.
items.rationale: Disregarding rules can be Boldness but also aligns with Disinhibition.

items.text: I often act without thinking about the consequences.
items.rationale: Acting without considering consequences is a key feature of Disinhibition.

items.text: He struggles to control his impulses.
items.rationale: Difficulty with impulse control is central to Disinhibition.

items.text: I frequently find myself in trouble for not following rules.
items.rationale: Getting into trouble for rule-breaking is indicative of Disinhibition.

items.text: She often speaks out of turn, interrupting others.
items.rationale: Interrupting others is a behavior associated with Disinhibition.

items.text: I have a hard time sticking to a routine.
items.rationale: Difficulty with routines is a sign of Disinhibition.

items.text: He often acts on a whim, without planning.
items.rationale: Acting on whims is characteristic of Disinhibition.

items.text: I find it hard to resist temptations.
items.rationale: Struggling with temptation is a key aspect of Disinhibition.

items.text: She often makes decisions that she later regrets.
items.rationale: Regretting impulsive decisions is indicative of Disinhibition.

items.text: I tend to act first and think later.
items.rationale: Acting before thinking is a hallmark of Disinhibition.

items.text: He often finds himself in chaotic situations.
items.rationale: Chaotic situations can result from Disinhibition but also from Boldness.

items.text: I sometimes ignore responsibilities to have fun.
items.rationale: Ignoring responsibilities can be Disinhibition but also low Conscientiousness.

items.text: I often disregard others' feelings when making decisions.
items.rationale: Disregarding others' feelings can be Disinhibition but also Meanness.

items.text: I enjoy seeing others fail.
items.rationale: Deriving pleasure from others' failures is a key feature of Meanness.

items.text: He often mocks others for their mistakes.
items.rationale: Mocking others is indicative of Meanness.

items.text: I rarely feel guilty about hurting others.
items.rationale: Lack of guilt for causing harm is a hallmark of Meanness.

items.text: She enjoys manipulating people to get what she wants.
items.rationale: Manipulation for personal gain is a trait of Meanness.

items.text: I often use others' weaknesses against them.
items.rationale: Exploiting weaknesses is a behavior associated with Meanness.

items.text: He feels no remorse for his harsh words.
items.rationale: Lack of remorse for harshness is indicative of Meanness.

items.text: I find it easy to lie to get my way.
items.rationale: Lying for personal advantage is a characteristic of Meanness.

items.text: She often belittles others to feel superior.
items.rationale: Belittling others is a sign of Meanness.

items.text: I have little empathy for others' suffering.
items.rationale: Lack of empathy is a core aspect of Meanness.

items.text: He enjoys causing discomfort to others.
items.rationale: Enjoying others' discomfort is indicative of Meanness.

items.text: I sometimes feel indifferent to others' needs.
items.rationale: Indifference to others can be Meanness but also low Agreeableness.

items.text: She occasionally uses sarcasm to hurt others.
items.rationale: Using sarcasm to hurt can be Meanness but also a form of Disinhibition.

items.text: I often disregard others' opinions if they conflict with my own.
items.rationale: Disregarding others' opinions can be Meanness but also Boldness.
